intro: Saccolabium virgatum, commonly known as the virginal saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Saccolabium virgatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
